titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ann E. Finley papers, 1845
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, September 2018

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Collection comprises a letter Finley wrote to her mother, Ruth Finley. Topics included health matters, religious gatherings, spinning and weaving to make cloth, and visits to family members. A postscript was added to the letter, possibly by Ann's husband, that discussed the weather; pig slaughtering; planting crops of wheat, rye, and tobacco; and prices for pork, flour, and corn.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Ann E. Finley Papers, 1845, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, September 2018.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection comprises a letter Finley wrote to her mother, Ruth Finley. Topics included health matters, religious gatherings, spinning and weaving to make cloth, and visits to family members. A postscript was added to the letter, possibly by Ann's husband, that discussed the weather; pig slaughtering; planting crops of wheat, rye, and tobacco; and prices for pork, flour, and corn.
